clinical_study.brief_title: Coronary Artery Disease (CAD) in Patients HIV-infected
clinical_study.official_title: ROLE OF IMMUNE ACTIVATION PROFILES IN CORONARY ATHEROTHROMBOSIS IN PATIENTS HIV-1-INFECTED ON EFFECTIVE ANTIRETROVIRAL THERAPY

brief_summary.textblock: HIV-infected patients with intermediate-high risk have a high prevalence of CAD and a substantial proportion of obstructive CAD. Degree of stenosis is associated with immunoactivation (lymphocyte and monocyte) and microbial translocation

primary_outcome.measure: correlation between a particular profile of immune activation in patients HIV under treatment presenting cardiovascular risk factors and the presence of coronary atheromatous plaques
primary_outcome.description: Assessment of the prevalence of obstructive coronary artery disease in patients infected with HIV and asymptomatic with a 64-slice CT coronary angiography.

secondary_outcome.measure: Identify the bacterial populations constituting the intestinal microbiota in patients infected with HIV and look for a microbiotic signature in patients with subclinical atherothrombosis.

arm_group.arm_group_label: HIV-1 patients and treated effectively for more than 12 months
arm_group.description: X-ray examination with contrast by a 64-slice CT coronary angiography.

intervention.description: x-ray examination with contrast by a 64-slice CT coronary angiography.
intervention.arm_group_label: HIV-1 patients and treated effectively for more than 12 months

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
HIV-infected patients >= 45 years with 2 or more CV risk factors currently on ART HIV-RNA < 50 copies >= 12 months (one blip allowed) Asymptomatic regarding cardiac symptoms (chest pain, syncope, dyspnea) Stable ART for more than 6 months
Exclusion Criteria:
- Sign of coronary pathology (chest pain, syncope, dyspnea).
- ATCD of allergy to IV contrast agents
- Chronic inflammatory disease other than HIV
- Subject to a measure for the protection of justice
